TITLE: Yellen says the U.S. and its allies should use ‘friend-shoring’ to give supply chains a boost
SUMMARY: The term draws on the concepts of "onshoring" and "nearshoring," which refer to the transferring of supply chains back home or closer to home.

TITLE: China holdings of U.S. debt fall below $1 trillion for the first time since 2010
SUMMARY: China's holdings of U.S. debt have fallen below $1 trillion for the first time in 12 years. Rising rates have made Treasurys potentially less attractive.

TITLE: Retail sales rose more than expected in June as consumers remain resilient despite inflation
SUMMARY: Advance retail sales were expected to increase 0.9% in June, according to Dow Jones estimates.

TITLE: Wholesale prices shoot up near-record 11.3% in June on surge in energy costs
SUMMARY: The producer price index, a measure of the prices received at the wholesale level, increased 11.3% from a year ago.

TITLE: Fed report finds higher fears of inflation and potential recession
SUMMARY: A Fed survey pointed to elevated recession fears along with a belief that soaring inflation will last at least through the end of the year.

TITLE: Inflation rose 9.1% in June, even more than expected, as consumer pressures intensify
SUMMARY: The consumer price index, soared 9.1% from a year ago, above the 8.8% Dow Jones estimate.

TITLE: Near-term inflation expectations hit record high, New York Fed survey shows
SUMMARY: Consumers' inflation expectations over the next year hit record highs, though the outlook over the longer term grew a little more optimistic.

TITLE: U.S. recession looks likely — and there are 3 ways the economy could get hit, analyst says
SUMMARY: The odds of the U.S. economy falling into recession by next year are greater than 50%, TD Securities said Monday, outlining three possible ways it could get hit.

TITLE: Big payroll gains push recession fears into the corner — for now
SUMMARY: June's big payroll jump helped clear away some of those recession clouds for a U.S. economy that nonetheless faces some stormy weather ahead.

TITLE: Unemployment rate for Black women fell in June, but so did their participation in the labor force
SUMMARY: The U.S. unemployment rate fell for Black women last month, but labor force participation also slipped for the group.

TITLE: Payrolls increased 372,000 in June, more than expected, as jobs market defies recession fears
SUMMARY: Nonfarm payrolls were expected to increase by 250,000 in June, according to Dow Jones estimates.

TITLE: Goldman slashes GDP forecast for the second quarter to just barely above water
SUMMARY: Goldman sliced its outlook for second-quarter GDP to an annualized gain of just 0.7%, down from the previous expectation of a 1.9% increase.

TITLE: Fed officials Waller and Bullard back another big interest rate increase in July
SUMMARY: The Fed is well on its way to another sharp interest rate hike in July and perhaps September as well, even if it slows the economy.

TITLE: Fed sees 'more restrictive' policy as likely if inflation fails to come down, minutes say
SUMMARY: Members said the July meeting likely also would see another 50 or 75 basis point move on top of a 75 basis point increase approved in June.

TITLE: Raising interest rates is the wrong solution to the inflation problem, analyst says
SUMMARY: Raising interest rates to tame demand isn't the right solution, as high prices have been driven mainly by supply chain shocks, one analyst said.

TITLE: Watch Fed Chair Powell talk live about the economy, interest rates at ECB forum
SUMMARY: Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell speaks Wednesday to a European Central Bank forum on central banking.

TITLE: Atlanta Fed GDP tracker shows the U.S. economy is likely in a recession
SUMMARY: A Federal Reserve tracker of economic growth is pointing to an increased chance that the U.S. economy has entered a recession.

TITLE: Fed’s preferred inflation measure rose 4.7% in May, around multi-decade highs
SUMMARY: Core personal consumption expenditures prices, excluding food and energy, rose 4.7% from a year ago, slightly less than expected.

TITLE: Powell vows to prevent inflation from taking hold in the U.S. for the long run
SUMMARY: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell vowed Wednesday that policymakers would not allow inflation to take hold of the U.S. economy over the longer term.

TITLE: New York Fed President John Williams says a U.S. recession is not his base case
SUMMARY: New York Fed President John Williams said he expects the economy to avoid recession even as he sees significantly higher rates to control inflation.

TITLE: Powell tells Congress the Fed is 'strongly committed' on inflation, notes recession is a 'possibility'
SUMMARY: Fed Chairman Jerome Powell said Wednesday that the central bank is determined to bring down inflation and has the ability to make that happen.

TITLE: U.S. recession isn't 'inevitable,' but inflation is 'unacceptably high,' Treasury Secretary Yellen says
SUMMARY: Talk of a recession has accelerated this year as inflation remains high and the Federal Reserve takes aggressive steps to counter.

TITLE: Inflation and recession fears are squeezing some industries more than others
SUMMARY: Inflation has been pushing prices higher, and shoppers are feeling the pressure as they pay more for goods like groceries and gas.

TITLE: Here are the three things the Fed has done wrong, and what it still isn't getting right
SUMMARY: The Federal Reserve suddenly finds itself second-guessed as it tries to navigate the economy through inflation and away from recession.

TITLE: Fed promises 'unconditional' approach to taking down inflation in report to Congress
SUMMARY: Federal Reserve officials rolled out strong language Friday to describe their approach to inflation, promising a full-fledged effort to restore price stability.

TITLE: Powell vows that the Fed is 'acutely focused' on bringing down inflation
SUMMARY: Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell on Friday reiterated the central bank's commitment to bringing down inflation.

TITLE: Everyone knows inflation is on fire. This is what's really fueling it
SUMMARY: The three biggest inputs for the consumer price index, the most widely followed measure of inflation, are food, energy and shelter.

TITLE: A day after Powell's assurances about the economy, markets are worried that 'the Fed breaks something'
SUMMARY: The trouble is, the Fed's likely to get a recession anyway as data shows the economy is a far cry from stable.

TITLE: Powell says the Fed could hike rates by 0.75 percentage point again in July
SUMMARY: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell said Wednesday the central bank could raise interest rates by a similar magnitude at the next policy meeting in July.

TITLE: Here's what the Federal Reserve's 0.75 percentage point rate hike — the highest in 28 years — means for you
SUMMARY: The Fed announced its highest rate hike in 28 years to fight inflation. Here's how that impacts your credit card, mortgage, car loan, student debt and savings.
